properties.headline: Sydney Family Show - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Entertainment Quarter
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Family Show is taking place at The Entertainment Quarter from Saturday 9 to Monday 25 April from 10am to 5pm each day.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as families travel to and from The Sydney Family Show each day.

The precinct will be particularly busy while other events are held at the neighbouring Sydney Cricket Ground.

Parking update: due to the wet weather EP3 Showground Field car park will not be open today Saturday 9 April - parking in Moore Park will be very limited with multiple events on in the precinct. Attendees are urged to leave the car at home and consider the public transport options or allow plenty of extra time and arrive early.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in and around Moore Park on game days during the show so check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: Music concert - BOWRAL Old Hume Highway, Mittagong Road approaching Centennial Road
properties.publicTransport: Local shuttle buses will run from Bowral and Mittagong, check the event website for more details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend A Day On The Green concert featuring Crowded House at Centennial Vineyards in Bowral from 3.15pm to 8pm.

The speed limit will be reduced along Mittagong Rd approaching the site from 12pm until midnight. Traffic controllers will be on site to manage traffic flow on Mittagong Road at Kirkham Rd.

Lane closures and speed reductions will be in place on The Old Hume Highway approaching Centennial Rd from 12pm until midnight. Traffic controllers will be on site to manage traffic flow along The Old Hume Highway.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Olympic Park road closures - Easter Show

properties.headline: Sydney Royal Easter Show - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd
properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is included in tickets to the Show. Express trains and Major Event Buses are running daily. Regular route buses in Olympic Park are using different stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to visit the annual Sydney Royal Easter Show at Sydney Olympic Park each day from Friday 8 April until Tuesday 19 April. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Centenary Dr, Silverwater Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd throughout the show, particularly over the Easter Long Weekend. 

Attendees driving to the event should plan to arrive early and pre-book parking online (available until 11.59pm the night before your visit) to secure a space as parking will fill early each day.

**Car parks sold out - 10, 11 and 15 April:** all available parking spaces at Olympic Park are sold out for Sunday 10, Monday 11 and Good Friday 15 April. Catch public transport instead or park at a station commuter car park and connect with frequent trains to Olympic Park. If you have pre-booked a parking space, follow signage and directions of staff to your allocated spot.

Local roads in the precinct are closed for the duration of the Easter Show, see the Olympic Park interactive road closure map for details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd

webLinks.linkText: Anzac Day - TfNSW interactive road closure map

properties.headline: Anzac Day Dawn Service & March - SYDNEY CBD Martin Place, Elizabeth Street, Liverpool Street
properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is free on Anzac Day and additional early morning services will run. Buses will be diverting while roads are closed and Light rail services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall until 6am during the Dawn Service. Visit transportnsw.info for details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Major roads will be closed in the Sydney CBD for the Anzac Day Dawn Service in Martin Place from 4.15am and March on Elizabeth St from 9am. 

Motorists should avoid travelling through the CBD while roads are closed or expect delays and allow extra travel time. While roads are closed travel east/west across the CBD is maintained via Bridge St or via Goulburn St.

Key road closures:

  • From 2am to 4pm: roads around Martin Place including Castlereagh, George and Pitt streets between Hunter and King streets.
  • From 2am to 6pm: Angel Place and Ash St between George and Pitt Streets.
  • From 6am to 4pm: major roads along and surrounding the march route between Bridge St and Goulburn St including sections of Castlereagh, Elizabeth, King, Market, Hunter, Bent, Park, Bathurst, Phillip and Liverpool Streets.

There will be no managed vehicle access or access to/from driveways within the road closure footprint for the safety of participants and spectators. Pedestrians can cross the march route at the designated crossing point on Elizabeth St at Park St.

The pop up cycleway on Pitt St will be closed from 2am to 4pm between Hunter and King St, and from 6am to 4pm between Bridge and King St. Cycleways on Liverpool and Castlereagh Streets will also be closed.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on from 1am to 4pm on sections of Clarence St, Castlereagh St and Pitt St and from 5:30am to 4pm on various major roads between Bridge St and Goulburn St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents, businesses or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies so check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on the following roads around Randwick Racecourse:     

  • From 4am to 7pm on Darley Rd between Alison Rd and Randwick Gates Centennial Park (western side)
  • From 8am to 7pm on Ascot St between Doncaster Ave and Randwick Racecourse Ascot St Entry (both sides) 
  • From 3pm to 7pm on High St between UNSW Gates Two and Anzac Pde (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

The following roads outside the stadium will close prior to full-time for up to an hour to allow crowds to safely leave the venue.

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

While roads are closed motorists will be diverted via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

The Sydney Olympic Park precinct will be busy with thousands of Easter Show attendees. 

Car parks sold out - Fri 15 April: all available parking spaces at Olympic Park are sold out for Good Friday 15 April. If you haven't pre-booked a space consider the public transport options or alternatively you can park at a station commuter car park and connect with frequent trains to Olympic Park. If you have pre-booked your parking space, follow signage and directions of staff to your allocated spot.

Local roads in the Sydney Olympic Park precinct are closed while the Sydney Royal Easter Show is underway. See the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map for more details.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Warriors at the SCG. Kick-off from 2pm and full-time approx. 4pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access parking via Lang Rd, motorists travelling in the Eastern Distributor should use the Randwick exit. EP2 grass car park off Moore Park Rd will not be open.

Special event clearways are in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 1pm until 7pm on sections of Lang Rd, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: Country Music Festival - TAMWORTH Peel Street, Kable Avenue, Fitzroy Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the 50th annual country music festival in Tamworth from Monday 18 April until Sunday 24 April.

Road closures will be in place for the event between Monday 11 April and Tuesday 27 April to accommodate the event:

  • Peel St between White St and Brisbane St closed from 4am Friday 15 April to 7pm Monday 25 April
  • Fitzroy St between Smith Pl and Peel St closed from 5am Tuesday 12 April to 2pm Monday 25 April
  • Fitzroy St between Peel St and Kable Ave closed from 5am Monday 11 April to 2pm Wednesday 27 April
  • Kable Ave between Brisbane St and south of Fitzroy St closed from 5am Wednesday 13 April to 12pm midday Tuesday 26 April

Motorists travelling in the area during the festival should be aware of changed access conditions and follow the direction of traffic controllers and police on site.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Fish Market Easter Trading info

properties.headline: Fish Market Easter Trading - PYRMONT Pyrmont Bridge Road and Bridge Road approaching Sydney Fish Market
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Fish Market extended Easter Trading Hours will take place from Friday 15 until Monday 18 April.

Delays are expected on the Western Distributor approaching the Pyrmont and Glebe off-ramps as well as on local roads in the area. Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time as parking will be in very high demand.

Limited parking is available at Sydney Fish Market car park and additional parking is available on Good Friday only nearby at Sydney Secondary College on Pyrmont Bridge Rd.

Motorists should follow the direction of traffic controllers, particularly if car parks are at capacity.

Pedestrian access to the markets will be via the corner of Bank St and Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Pyrmont Bridge Rd near Wattle St and opposite the Fish Market Light Rail stop on Bank St.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.adviceB: Allow extra travel time; Expect delays
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 20,000 people are expected to attend the annual Groovin' the Moo music festival at the Maitland Showground from 10:30am to 10:30pm.

Local roads around Maitland Showground will close between 8am and midnight including sections of Anzac St, Blomfield St, Gipps St, Smith St, Rose St, Park St, Elgin St and Evans St.

The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h on The New England Hwy (Les Darcy Dr) approaching Maitland.

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be advised that traffic will be particularly heavy between 9am and 11am and between 8:30pm and 11:30pm as crowds arrive and leave the festival.

roads.mainStreet: New England Highway, Les Darcy Dr

properties.headline: Special event - COONABARABRAN Newell Highway between Cassilis Street AND Dalgarno Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Coonabarabran Easter Bunny Bazaar will be taking place from 8:30am until 1pm. 

To accommodate the event The Newell Hwy/John St between Cassilis St and Dalgarno St will be closed from 7:30am until 2pm.

Vehicles travelling northbound can detour around the closure via Cassillis St, Namoi St, Saleyards Rd and Gardner St. Vehicles travelling soutbound can detour around the closure via Essex St, Charles St and Edward St. Heavy vehicles travelling in both directions can detour around the closure via Edward St, Namoi St, Saleyards Rd and Gardener St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the direction of traffic controllers on site.

roads.mainStreet: Newell Highway

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed from 5:45pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St and will reopen after the game.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: Race day - RANDWICK Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street approaching Royal Randwick Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Race tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Championships Day 2 at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 11:35am. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on the following roads around Randwick Racecourse:     

  • From 4am to 7pm on Darley Rd between Alison Rd and Randwick Gates Centennial Park (western side)
  • From 8am to 7pm on Ascot St between Doncaster Ave and Randwick Racecourse Ascot St Entry (both sides) 
  • From 3pm to 7pm on High St between UNSW Gates Two and Anzac Pde (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.headline: A-League - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Brisbane Roar at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 5.05pm and full-time around 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street

properties.headline: Special event - CANOWINDRA Rodd Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The Canowindra International Balloon Challenge will be taking place in Canowindra from Saturday 2 until Sunday 10 April. 

On Saturday 9 April from 12pm until 10pm the speed limit on Canowindra Road (Rodd Street) between Thompson Street and Longs Corner Road will be reduced to 40km/h and will be under traffic control. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra time, follow the directions of traffic control on site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Rodd Street

properties.headline: NRL & Concert - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Dragons at Accor Stadium. Kick-off from 5:30pm and full-time approx 7:30pm. 

Delta Goodrem concert at Qudos Bank Arena, show starts from 8pm. 

The Sydney Olympic Park precinct will be busy with thousands of Easter Show attendees. Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Car parks sold out: all available parking spaces at Olympic Park are sold out for Saturday 9 April. If you haven't pre-booked a space consider the public transport options or park at a station commuter car park and connect with frequent trains to Olympic Park. If you have pre-booked your parking space, follow signage and directions of staff to your allocated spot.

Local roads in the Sydney Olympic Park precinct are closed while the Sydney Royal Easter Show is underway. See the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map for more details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.headline: AFL - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include return travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21  SHUTTLES EP23.pdf

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park special event clearways map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V004_22FEB22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v North Melbourne at the SCG. First bounce from 2:40pm, full-time around 5:20pm. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the match. 

Driver Ave is partially closed outside the stadium from 11.45am and will remain closed until crowds have safely cleared the precinct.

Access EP2 Kippax grass car park via Moore Park Rd or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit for EP2 or the Randwick exit for access to Lang Rd.

Parking update: due to the wet weather EP3 Showground Field car park will not be open - parking in Moore Park will be very limited with multiple events on in the precinct. Fans are urged to leave the car at home and consider the public transport options.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in and around Moore Park from 11am until 7pm including sections of Lang Rd, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 11AM TO 7PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Randle Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: Police Operation - SYDNEY CBD TO CAMPERDOWN Eddy Avenue, Pitt Street, George Street, Broadway approaching Victoria Park
properties.publicTransport: Some buses may experience delays, check service alerts at transportnsw.info for the latest information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place in the Sydney CBD between 3pm and 4pm for a planned Police Operation protest march from Central to Camperdown.

Rolling closures will be in place along sections of Eddy Ave, Pitt St southbound lanes, Railway Square, George St westbound lanes and Broadway westbound lanes between City Rd and Glebe Point Rd. Roads will progressively re-open.

Motorists should avoid the area during this time or expect delays and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

roads.mainStreet: Eddy Avenue, Pitt Street, George Street, Broadway
